entry.title: Combined summary - On soft-forks and hard-forks
entry.summary: The discussion in question is centered on whether to reject blocks with nVersions that a node does not expect, and the potential implications of doing so. Rejecting such blocks could lead to an isolated chain fork, which would be detrimental to Bitcoin's security model. Instead, it is suggested that these blocks be accepted and relayed, albeit with some minor safeguards to prevent DoS attacks.The discussion also delves into soft-forks and SPV nodes, ultimately concluding that it is acceptable for miners to upgrade their SPV nodes. The nVersion field can be utilized for voting on upgrades, and a two-stage approach is recommended to signal intent to upgrade and when the new rules will take effect. By allowing miners to upgrade their SPV nodes, the network can remain secure while still accommodating upgrades and changes.
